intro: Odontadenia nitida, commonly known as the toothed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features slender stems and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. Its leaves are narrow and often have a toothed or serrated edge, contributing to its common name. Odontadenia nitida is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
